Articles.Content:
So basically what this is a fake argument where you come up with reasons why team 1 or team a is better than the other. once you pick a side, you don't have to keep that side, but constantly flipping back and forth is a nono.

For example:

Team A member: team A is better because A has a higher value in hexadecimal than 1

Team 1 member: team 1 is better because 1 can be expressed with |e^ipi^|

Team 1 member: team 1 is better because right now it has more members

Etc...

I'll start

Team 1 is better, because it came first
Team A is better because there are only 26 letters. Exclusiveness is tantamount to greatness.
By that logic, Team 1 is better, because there are only 9 digits (assuming a base 10 counting system)

^^ Ten digits, 0-9. ![:)](//kerbal-forum-uploads.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/emoticons/default_k_smiley.gif)

A is better because it can represent any value in algebra.
A is for apple, aperture, and AP-SAP. 1 is for 1337.
Guys, remember this isn't only about the properties of 1 or A, its about the teams themselves too. That being said, Team 1 is better because Team A is too mainstream
Team A is better because team 1 is too hipster; therefore subculture and has no goverment support.
Team 1 is better than Team A because it is cool, and therefore has popular support.
Team A is better because they have better personal hygiene habits than the filthy, stinking Team 1.
Team 1 is better than Team A because 1^Ã‚Â°^ kelvin is really cool, but A^Ã‚Â°^ Kelvin doesn't make sense as a temperature, Thus Team 1 is cool, and Team A makes no sense
